Fields.DialogueText: @BATTLE
Another day, another battle won.
So workaday, Kanchou. Where's your sense of pride? We're making the world a better place!
We're saving lives, and I'm grateful for that. But I don't know if I'd count saving a coffee supply ship as having a huge strategic impact on the war.
What do you mean? Think of all of the farmers we're keeping in business. All those fresh, hand-picked beans just waiting to be ground up for us to greet the new day with.

Fields.MenuText: I just wish we could have gotten some for ourselves.
Fair enough. I never thought I'd have a hand in keeping coffee flowing.
Can't they grow somewhere less dangerous?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not running a protection racket out here! The Imperial Navy keeps me in plenty of sweet, sweet beans.
A noble cause if ever I heard of one. We're a wheel on several wagons!
You probably don't know it's not just about taste. Enthusiasts also care about where the coffee is grown as well.
You know, that reminds me. How much coffee did you requisition? The galley's full to bursting with some very familiar crates.
Nothing too colossal. Few hundred pounds.
A few hundred!?
Do you have any idea what three-hundred-some crew drinks, Kanchou? And that's not even taking me into account.
Maybe if you cut back, we'd have more space for essentials.
Different essentials. No worries. It'll be gone in no time.
That's what I'm worried about...
*ALARM*
Steady on. Anything could happen.
We'll blast them to kingdom come, Kanchou! This could be our biggest mission yet!
The Morganas have been merciless with those supply ships lately.
Must be tea people.
I highly doubt that.
Got any better ideas?

Fields.MenuText: They want to keep the sea free of humans.
The Morganas thirst for our blood.
I really don't know.

Fields.DialogueText: If there's one thing you humans don't take kindly to, it's being shown a frontier and told not to explore it.
Just wild animals frenzyin' for blood, huh? I'd believe that if they didn't seem to enjoy it so much.
Maybe a little more coffee would get that creativity flowing.
I wonder if it's because there are a lot of islands in our area. If their intent is to starve us out...
Tabun. They really don't like you humans. And why attack Kami head on when they know we're too smart for 'em?
Good weakness to have.
The best ones make us strong.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Better to hit you where you're weak.
Humans are a weakness of ours.
Hey, Kanchou, it's mail day! Got a secret someone you write love letters to?
Well, if I answered that, would they be a secret?
Ah! Blushing! You do have someone you like, don't you?

Fields.MenuText: That's none of your business.
Well, there's someone on my mind...
I have no time for romance.

Fields.DialogueText: Fine, I'll stop bothering you. But I keep a good secret. Just give me the first letter of their name!
Care to drop any hints? A man? A woman? Give a Kami a hint!
Sure you do. I see you staring at the sea like some fool waiting for a mermaid to surface. That's pretty romantic if you ask me.
What about you? I see you're holding a letter over there.
This old thing? Oh, this is from a good friend. He works aboard one of the Sendai-class girls.
A "friend," or a friend?
Just a friend. One of the first to see me awaken, actually. But no matter where we are, we're keeping the world safe from those monsters.
I was going to make a joke about reminiscing over old times, but--
You can stick around, Kanchou. You know, you remind me of him. A strong leader. Good head on your shoulders. That kind of thing.
No romance, eh?
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
That's an uncharted trail, Kanchou. But those are the best kind.
And sometimes we like to talk about how that's going.
I know. It really wasn't that long ago. Seems that way, though, doesn't it?
It's a busy world. I'll let you get back to your correspondence.
Crazy talk...
What's wrong?
My friend came off worst in a battle. The ship's okay, but the crew took a mauling.
What happened?
Lucky shots and mist sickness. They didn't have enough strength to beat all of the Funayūrei. He barely escaped.

Fields.MenuText: He's lucky to be alive.
That's going to set us back.
The Morganas are getting stronger.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right, Kanchou. He is lucky. It's a good thing he was able to get away. But his group's out of the fight for a while.
We can't win them all.
They're getting smarter as well.
What else does the letter say?
You may want to sit down. Because it doesn't sound very good.
Yūbari, you look disturbed. The last time I saw you like this, it was when we ran out of coffee for two days.
It's nothing like that. Actually, it's much, much worse.
Let's get some coffee. You're shaking.
Hot water for me, Kanchou. I'm already wide awake.
... And I think we're both going to be stimulated enough all too soon.
@BATTLE
Now, tell me what the letter from your friend said.
He said that the government had betrayed them. That they called for help, but no one came. It was as if they were abandoned.
Is he all right? Apart from being angry?
Never better, he says. For some reason... he was one of a few who came out unscathed. And he says he has the Funayūrei to thank for that.

Fields.MenuText: He's probably bluffing.
Repay them how?
Ah, hell. We need to stop him.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't think he's bluffing, Kanchou. If there's anything I know about him, it's that he's always gone forward on his word.
Patrol routes, radio codes... If he gets to them, no matter what he's planning, it'll only help the Funayūrei.
You're right. I need to find out where his head's at. Then we can wrangle him.
Say, what's this friend of yours called, anyway?
His name? Well, I always called him Whistler. It's a long story.
Early days?
Very early. Truth be told, I'm the one who gave him that name!
You're a trailblazer.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Thank them?
And he intends to repay them in kind.
Damn straight! And a bloodhound once I get a scent.
Looks like something's got our scent.
We'll just have to bloody their noses!
Nasty, aren't they? I've seen friendlier faces in a snake pit.
At sea?
@BATTLE
Whistler can't have gone far, but I don't know what we should do when we find him. Think about it, Kanchou. Really, what would you do?

Fields.MenuText: If he hasn't crossed any lines yet, just try to talk him around.
Question him and go from there.
What would the military police do? That's the real question.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope we can change his mind. He was always so stubborn. That is, if we can even find him.
I'm sure he had a good reason. No, probably not. I don't know. If we find him, we'll get the truth out!
I believe there's something more to it than just desertion, Kanchou. He wouldn't defect. He couldn't.
No ifs, and no maybes, Yūbari. We're going to find him. I have faith in us. Like you said, he's nearby.
Right. I'll go grab the navigator. I'm sure we can't be far behind.
And don't worry, Yūbari. It's not like you to be nervous.
Hai. I've already had three cups of coffee to calm my nerves today.
Maybe you should switch to decaf.
Never! I'd miss his clues otherwise.
You should really read more Lone Ranger, Kanchou!
Now if I'm reading this right, we should be able to find him in no time. He wanted us to decipher his rough coordinates...
How do you know? The military censor should be intercepting this mail.
Smoke signals. At least, that's what we call it.
I guess that's the best I'm getting out of you.
I get strongly worded letters about my wardrobe from the Home Ministry once or twice a month. Makes a girl creative.
Damn it. How did we get ourselves into this Funayūrei quagmire?
We can only spare so much time for a rescue mission. It was hunt down a friendly mountain pass or go through the one with the outlaws.
Well, I hope you're prepared for a shootout.
Fully loaded and one in the chamber!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, are you hurt?

Fields.MenuText: That was a tough battle.
I just need to walk it off.
I'm fine, really.

Fields.DialogueText: I can't believe the Funayūrei got the jump on us like that. They must be moving faster, lately.
That's a good sign, Kanchou. We both need to stay strong!
I'm keeping an eye on you. We shut out a lot during battle that we ought not to.
Yūbari, please. I don't need you to help me out right now.
I'm just trying to help. We have to keep moving. Whistler could be in the clutches of the Funayūrei already!
You're sure he's...
I'm not. But we've got to find out.
But what if--
To have a friend, you have to be one. He'd do the same for me.
There's no way you'd get captured.
That just makes it my responsibility to make sure he doesn't either.
Hi-yo, Kanchou! Away!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, quit lollygagging! We have to keep moving!
You're quite lively today. Had enough coffee?
Just the usual, actually. I've been energized. Do I seem perky?
More so than usual? I admit it's hard to tell.
Well, whatever I am, get used to me.
Vigilance and preparation, Kanchou. Without those, your campfire might as well be a signal beacon for wolves and bandits.
You hear wild things about the frontier, Kanchou. Some of it's true. Some of it's not. That's why it's dangerous.
We'll see this rescue through, Yūbari. If Whistler knew you were coming, he'd have nothing to worry about.
In a way, he got this whole tumbleweed rolling. You know he introduced me to coffee?
So he's to blame for unleashing you upon the world.
Some Kami are born with tastes, memories, knowledge... but I don't do the whole tea ceremony thing. That's Hiryū's business.
"Java?"
*ALARM*
Can we get a recording of you saying that instead of our alarm?
American copyright and Japanese censorship. If only they'd cancel each other out.
The lookouts could certainly get used to it. You've taken all their shifts for the last few days.

Fields.MenuText: More cowboy comics?
I doubt we've got much to worry about from pirates out here.
Give yourself a break. That's why we've got lookouts.

Fields.DialogueText: You never know, Kanchou. All it takes is one rowboat full of smart ones in the dead of night.
I can't, Kanchou. Not until we get to the bottom of this.
Give me a good, strong cup of java and I'm set for the day!
Like the island! They grow all the best stuff.
How much pain would you have to be in to seek out the Morganas? They're monsters.
Monsters shaped a lot like humans. It's easier to fall for something with a face.
You Belles are proof enough of that.
That's what I liked about him. He never gave up, even if it meant punching way above his weight.

Fields.MenuText: I can see why someone as adventurous as you would be a friend of his.
There's determination and then there's recklessness.
He must have been a handful.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course! That kind of drive keeps you going out on the dusty trail.
Gotta get licked by one to master the other.
One of those who needs a good whack now and again. Part of being a Kami is learning how to hold back for those.
Your opinion on him hasn't changed since he turned?
Some people can't just look out the window at a dust storm. He needs to catch it full in the face. Hopefully we'll be the ones to give it to him.
The stories you hear about what the Morganas do to people... I couldn't imagine wanting to see that up close.
That's respectable too, Kanchou. It takes someone special to step up and put a stop to evil. I think... I think Whistler still wants to, in his own way.
These Funayūrei can tell him we said hello.
@BATTLE
Sōdane! You lucked out with us.
I wouldn't be surprised if he thought he could deal with them, though.
Arigatō. I was in the radio room most of last night.
Lone Ranger?
I wish. Just thinking of a friend. Whistler used to volunteer for late radio room shifts, you know.
Enthusiast, eh?
Amateur radio operator, before even the war in China. He told me he still liked to listen in on different frequencies and try and decipher what he heard.
He liked stories, Kanchou. The big and the little that the everyday details could tell. And over time, he got very good at filling in blanks.
He certainly filled in the one that the Imperial Navy left. I just hope he hasn't done something he can't take back.
There's no such thing as taking something back. All you can do is grow stronger than whatever monster you've helped create, and fight it, and win.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not really the forgiving type.
Nothing short of total atonement.
Time.

Fields.DialogueText: No one has to be. That's a possibility everyone has to live with.
It's a long road, but it's a road anyone can find their way down. Eventually.
And lots of it. Sometimes nothing else will do.
Bits and pieces, when he could make head or tail of it. Trajectories without destinations. Wind patterns without the flags they ruffled.
Coffee?
Just the way you like it. You looked like you needed it.
Always, Kanchou. Black?
What did he hear?
If someone you cared for did something hurtful, what would it take for you to forgive them?
We'll figure out how to forgive him when we know what we need to forgive.
We shouldn't be far from him, if he's still where he said he'd be.
Just follow the Morganas, right?
I don't like it, but you're not wrong.
@BATTLE
Yūbari, do you see that black shadow out there?
More Funayūrei? It never ends...
Too small. It looks like a lifeboat. How the hell is it--
Wait, I see him! Whistler! Can we get any closer?

Fields.MenuText: We can't risk it. This feels like a trap.
We can try, but I've got lookouts and radio on high alert.
Let's wait to see if he comes to us.

Fields.DialogueText: The Funayūrei don't normally let the small fry go, do they? If he's still alive, it's for a reason.
Good instinct. We just have to listen close... to him and to anyone else who happens to be listening.
I don't think that's going to happen, Kanchou. He's asked us to come to him. We're at arm's length, even if he does trust us.
The radio's yours if you want to  talk to him.
I'll turn it on. Let's see... the frequency he used should be...
*RADIO STATIC*
This is Yūbari's captain, please respond. I repeat, this is Yūbari's captain, please respond.
*STATIC*
Whistler, are you there?
*ALARM*
Not now! Kanchou, hit them hard!
@BATTLE
Say something.
... while you still can...
*STATIC*
Kanchou, did you hear that?
Yūbari? Is that you?
That's his voice! Whistler, it's you! We came here to help. Are you all right?
I'm not going to change my mind, Yūbari. The government has broken their promise to its people.
We were abandoned! All because I got sloppy. The things I've heard...
What, Whistler? What did you hear?

Fields.MenuText: The longer this conversation lasts, the easier the Morganas can find us.
Leave him. He's not making sense.
I don't know what to say.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, wait! It sounds like he knows something.
Just be patient, Kanchou. We still haven't heard his side.
Then I'll say it. Whistler, please, I can put in a good word for you!
Look for the box. It's fireproof. Everything you need is in there. Remember my signal?
"Fireproof?" Yūbari, what--
Whistler!
He's still afloat! Keep an eye on him!
@BATTLE
Whistler, I don't understand. You were attacked--
*BOOM*
The Kami... The Funayūrei... It can't be a coincidence. If there's a reason you appeared, this is it.
... What's that whistling sound?
Is the retrieval team back yet?
I'm sorry, Yūbari. There was no sign of him.
I see.

Fields.MenuText: We can still find him.
What did he mean?
Do you need a minute?

Fields.DialogueText: No, Kanchou, we can't. Not if he... doesn't want to be found.
I can make some educated guesses.
I've got all the time in the world. I'll find a few.
They found the black box, too. He's... we're... lucky his vessel didn't take a direct hit.
We can take a look later. We're in hot zone and we need to get out.
But Whistler--
Whistler told me the same thing!
@BATTLE
Did they...
Just returned.
One of the last times we spoke... he said he might have found a problem bigger than he was. He hoped I'd pick up where he left off when he felt he could go no further.
Whatever he wants us to find out, we can find it out when we're in safer waters.
Then why leak it to the Morganas?
When you're in a desert, keep walking. We can do this!
@BATTLE
I wish we'd gotten to him quicker. If there was anything I could have done...
This is what war is all about. He used to say that as well.
Giving your life for what you believe in?
Even if that means doing things that you aren't proud of. Whatever you put into the world... you have to be prepared to take out. that's what he used to say.

Fields.MenuText: Some orders I wouldn't follow.
Well, if there was no other choice...
Of course. War is hell, but it's war.

Fields.DialogueText: Easy for you to say. You don't get your fuel from the ones giving them.
There's always a choice, Kanchou. Maybe it's a long way off. But you have to be looking for the right time to make it, whatever it might be.
Try living there.
Get some rest, Yūbari. If you need anything... don't hesitate to talk about it.
We're surrounded, Yūbari!
I won't, Kanchou. It's easier, though... He and I had a signal, did you know?
To keep in touch?
After a fight, just to let me know he'd come through okay. He could whistle so loud, I could hear him clear across the deck. Fore to aft.
So the signal he mentioned...
The whistle you heard. He must have done his part, whatever it was. And now it's our turn.
Yūbari, I brought you some coffee.
Just set it aside, Kanchou. I feel a little queasy.
It's not like you to decline some fresh coffee.
I still haven't looked in the box.

Fields.MenuText: Take all the time you need.
Do we even want to?
Shall I?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm almost there, Kanchou. Just... processing.
No. That's why we have to.
If you like. But I have a feeling you'll want me there.
What do you think you'll find?
I have a pretty good idea.
You didn't choose to be built, or where to fight.
I'm just trying to help people. That's why I'm with the Fleet. I can't do it alone.
Not as far and wide as you can see. But we have to try.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I'm not blind to what's going on in your world, Kanchou. What you humans did to each other before the Kami. What you're still trying to do.
What I'm pledged to assist with.
Whistler chose. It's what I admired about him. It's what I admire about you.
Looks like we're not out of the woods yet.
All right, crew! Let's get this ship clean. We have to tidy up the deck! Make sure all ammunition is accounted for! Yarimashō!
The coffee's working again.
I haven't had any! We've got orders to rejoin the main patrol route. And Whistler's group is among them!

Fields.MenuText: What's left of them.
About time. I think they were getting suspicious.
What do you plan on doing with them?

Fields.DialogueText: For their sake, we'll make sure his work is done.
We never leave anyone behind, Kanchou. The Lone Ranger wouldn't.
Putting together the puzzle that Whistler was working on.
Think about it. Whistler said the Navy left his group to fend for itself. We'll have his people and his superiors to talk to and the box for evidence.
Whistler may have lost faith in his people, but I haven't. We just need to find out what his group was doing and why they were hung out to dry.
And what's in the box.
Working on it.
Any progress?
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
To make sure this kind of thing never happens again.
It's slow. His handwriting's not the best.
Good thing it's in a fireproof box.
Some of this might have well have been pulled out of a campfire...
What have we learned?
We're out of coffee.

Fields.MenuText: What was it?
What does that mean?
What if it's not?

Fields.DialogueText: Something about technology... and not human technology.
It means they were up to something Japan wanted kept to herself.
Then there's nothing to worry about.
Let me see. Hmm...
A laboratory out of Kawasaki. They ran into some pirates... no, rogue elements of the Imperial Navy? Someone defected?
In the middle of a war with demons?
So Whistler wasn't the only one who didn't like what he saw. And his group was tasked with seeing it.
So what do we do with this?
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
That was fast.
I've been working on this around the clock. It gets to be more or less like water after you sip enough.
I thought the hull was shaking. My morning coffee was getting choppy.
If what Whistler says is true... officially, his group's mission didn't exist.
Funayūrei weaponry? Who was studying this?
I'll do what Whistler couldn't. I'm a Kami... They'll listen to me.
Whoever "they" happen to be.
Kanchou, we need to get this to Command! To the General Staff! To the Emperor!
Slow down. What's going on?
The things Whistler was listening in on - they're horrible! If what he said about this weapon is true... it could be more dangerous to us than to the Funayūrei!

Fields.MenuText: We need all the help we can get against them.
Are we sure he had the whole story?
Dangerous how?

Fields.DialogueText: We can win this war with their guns, Kanchou. What about the next one?
I'll transcribe it all for you, Kanchou. It'll keep you up without coffee.
It's destructive, Kanchou, and it can't be controlled!
They got a gun off of one of them. They might have even gotten as far as a prototype.
Whatever it was... it wasn't Funayūrei that mauled Whistler's group, Kanchou. That weapon went haywire. It started firing and didn't stop until...
Until it was done. Done blasting holes in ships, boiling the sea around them... with no visible source of ammunition.
What kind of weapon shoots itself?
The kind that can't be trusted in human hands. Imagine if it got out. Imagine if it was mass-produced. Imagine...
I don't want to.
We need to bring this to the light. For Whistler... no, for you.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Until?
Me?
Your species. This is bigger than any of us.
And maybe a little bit for you.
Not even Lone Ranger comics could wash it out of my memory.
Nor should they. Thank goodness he did the right thing in the end.
He pushed the weapon overboard.

Fields.MenuText: The right thing isn't always the smart thing.
If they'd gotten it back to Japan...
And stole a lifeboat besides.

Fields.DialogueText: If I thought it was me or the world... I'd choose the world.
There's a lot of Funayūrei and a lot of scientists. Inquiring minds want to know. They'll keep looking.
His heart was in the right place. I'm willing to forgive a lot for... for this.
Are we sure kicking this upstairs is the way to go?
That's the hope. I'm more worried about what will happen if they're intrigued.
I've been thinking about that too. Trying not to. Failing.
Then stop trying.
Not in my blood, Kanchou.
I mean... don't worry about it.
To fight when necessary for what is right... That's what the Lone Ranger's all about.
@BATTLE
I've been reading Whistler's reports. You weren't kidding about this stuff.
If the Navy General Staff knew about this, they'd be horrified. Maybe even the Army, too.
It's bad. But you know what we need to do. If someone doesn't raise concerns, who will? Like you said, they'll listen to you.
If anyone can do it, it's you.
Usually is. Arigatō, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
... You've read The Lone Ranger?
You read out loud when you're excited. Couldn't help but overhear.
Now we wait.
The original. I've still got the transcriptions I made.

Fields.MenuText: Trust but verify, eh?
Who do we go to with those?
Stashed somewhere safe?

Fields.DialogueText: Always keep one in the chamber.
You're looking at her.
Slipped 'em into one of my comic books. Even I have trouble digging through them all.
What do we do until then?
Enjoy this delicious, delicious coffee.
Well, good. I made it much stronger just in case you... Don't drink it all at once!
This is AMAZING!
Wow, I didn't expect it to be that good.
You surprise me every day.
Thank goodness we're close to some Funayūrei. You'd be bouncing off the walls all day without something to bounce at.
Admit it. You like it.
@BATTLE
I've heard about this. There's milk in it.
You sent the box to Command?
Cappuccino. I figured you could use something sweet to take the edge off the espionage.
Even cowboys drink milk. Strong bones and all that. And if it's from you, it's okay.
Is that a problem?
Mail day. Looks like we've got a love letter from the General Staff.
Those fogies couldn't romance their way out of one of their own smoke-filled rooms.

Fields.MenuText: No optimism?
It's the best we're going to get.
It's not.

Fields.DialogueText: I note your concerns about my coffee intake all the time, Kanchou. Do the math.
I was afraid of this.
Well, don't read ahead.
Unbelievable. Their only problem is with the loss of the weapon.
"The regrettable actions of the sailor in question..." They don't even name him.
So they're going to keep looking for a replacement. They're going to keep spending lives to find ways to destroy even more.
We knew this might happen.
Some part of me expected it. I just... If there were even a chance that they'd see reason...
They saw reason. It's cold and it's dangerous, but it's reason nonetheless.
What are we fighting for, Kanchou?
Oh, I don't know. "To whom the war effort may concern" always brings a blush to my cheeks.
Must be a human thing. What's it say?
Hmm... "The project henceforth referred to as 'Yomotsu-shikome' is a matter of considerable interest to the Imperial General Headquarters. The concerns of the Kami Yūbari have been noted..."
That doesn't sound promising.
And Whistler?
Our lives. That's all we can do right now.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
You haven't touched the coffee I brought you.
You also haven't moved since yesterday, when I brought it.
Is the comic really that good?
Yūbari, we've talked about this.
Not when there were heroes and warriors on the wide open frontier. When I believed there were.

Fields.MenuText: There were people like them.
Well, we were certainly looking in the wrong place.
There still can be.

Fields.DialogueText: Not nearly enough, and not all they were cracked up to be.
Furthest away from any real heroics.
When? Where? Who?
Well, what now?
What, indeed? We keep fighting this war so you can turn on each other again? It's still happening on land!
Don't need it.
Haven't I?
It's a nice escape, Kanchou. Reminds me of better days.
I hate the Funayūrei, Kanchou. But I'm starting to see why Whistler went to them. It's a lot harder to fight over land and resources if everyone just stays home.
Maybe that's what they're here for.
But it's not what you're here for.
Then why am I here?
To save us from the Funayūrei. Not to save us from ourselves. That's our responsibility, just like it was Whistler's.
It's a shame you're not more responsible. You as a species, I mean, not-- you know.
History of the world. Let's fight for another shot.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Give me the radio, Kanchou?
No.
Heh. Thought you'd say that. Don't worry. I'm not in a rebel mood.

Fields.MenuText: Who would you have called?
Holing up with comics and coffee is rebellious?
Somehow I don't believe you.

Fields.DialogueText: The mainland? The Americans? Would it help?
In a sad world, happiness counts.
Let's say I'm getting better at managing it.
I wonder if we'd find any allies among the other Belles.
Among the Imperial Navy? Hmm... I don't know. A lot of them are sympathetic to the cause.
And the Japanese cause. Divine servants of the Emperor, and all that. Why wouldn't we be? Why wouldn't we want to use the enemy's weapons against them, if it meant his realm would be secure?
There's no taking the project back, is there?
Sure doesn't look like it. And whatever you put into the world, you have to be prepared to take out.
Because if you're not, you leave a pretty big mess for other people to clean up.
People like Whistler. People like you.
And you, Kanchou. Don't think you're getting out of this.
Out of what?
Don't know yet. But we'll think of something.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
The human cause.
That's one well-worn comic book. Writing a letter to the editor?
Somehow I'm not really satisfied with where this latest story's ended up.

Fields.MenuText: So what was the point?
Maybe it's a prologue.
The journey hasn't changed him at all?

Fields.DialogueText: Still being made.
One hopes. I feel like it was just about to get interesting.
Maybe a little bit. We'll have to see.
You want to know what I think?
I read too many comic books?
Just the right amount, I think. I seem to remember you talking a big game about fighting the good fight far away from those who can't.
True enough. Everyone has within themselves the power to make this a better world. That's the Lone Ranger's creed.
Still makes you a cowgirl.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
The bad guy got away?
And the good guy's right back where he started.
I wish I could hop on Silver and just ride, Kanchou. Graze him wherever and move on.
But we make the most of what equipment we have, wherever we're sent. Remember, I'm a cruiser first and a cowgirl second.
You know, we have those in Japan too.
Cattle ranchers?
Masterless warriors. We call 'em rōnin. Means "wave man," funnily enough. Drifters. Someday... I'd sure like to try my hand at being one.
The Navy might take issue with that.
The Navy's the Navy, and right now I've got to deal with that. But the Emperor's the Emperor.
You'll be riding off into the sunset. Ought to stand out in the Land of the Rising Sun.
He summoned me here for a purpose, Kanchou. The Funayūrei... well, they're step one. This war won't go on forever.
The Navy needs me now. But one day they won't. And by the time that day comes...
Trailblazer, remember? You better be ready to follow it.
We've set a new course, Yūbari.
Oh? Where to?
The Sea of Japan.
Why? I don't recall hearing about Funayūrei in those parts lately.
Command figured we could use some time on the home front.
Whistler... I miss him, Kanchou. But he knew what had to be done, even if he couldn't be the one to do it.
Some days. Some days I need you to show me. That's what true partnerships are all about.
"Partnership." Heh. That's one way of putting it.
Kanchou? Can you make me that special cappuccino again? And when you do, I'll give you something special in return.
Nothing special about it. It's just coffee, milk, and sugar.
You'll be with me when I go rōnin, won't you?
The Lone Ranger had Tonto.
Well, good. There's a lot wrong with this world, Kanchou. I can't make it all right here and I can't make it all right alone.
"And truth alone lives on forever." Doesn't mean it can't use some help now and again. I know that. You know that.
See? We've solved half the world's problems already.
Command figured I could use some time to cool down, no doubt. Well, they can huff and puff all they want. This twister won't be tamed forever.
Good. Let them huff and puff. They'll never learn to whistle.
You remind me of him, you know. You do too, don't you? Know what has to be done.

Fields.MenuText: Too clinical?

Fields.DialogueText: The General Staff couldn't have put it better.

Fields.MenuText: There are a lot of different types of partnerships.
The right way.

Fields.DialogueText: Why limit ourselves to just one?
A right way. I know a better way.
And a kiss is just skin on skin.
Point made.
One day you won't have to. How's that Lone Ranger creed go? "All things change but truth?"
You and me. That feels pretty true, too.
